member.summary: Pops all states in the stack.

member.summary: Pushes a state to the top of the stack without notifying the underlying state.

member.summary:
Creates a new Finite State Machine.
If you need control over how the states are created, you can register them manually using . If not, then you can freely use which will create the states using their default constructor.

If you need control over how the states are created, you can register them manually using . If not, then you can freely use which will create the states using their default constructor.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event
member.summary:
A simple event handler that uses interfaces instead of delegates to avoid the garbage generated by them.
This is the parameterless version. See if you need to send data with the event.
Listeners are required to implement the interface.
Events are differentiated by an integer. You are expected to create constants to define your events and make them unique.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event.Id
member.summary: Gets the ID of this event.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Event with the specified ID.
member.param: The id of the event.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event.AddListener(Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.IEventListener,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a listener for the event with an optional call-order priority.
member.param: The listener to add.
The priority of the listener compared to other listeners. Controls whether the listener is called before or after other listeners.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event.RemoveListener(Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.IEventListener)
member.summary: Removes a listener from the event.
member.param: The listener to remove

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event.Invoke
member.summary: Notifies all listeners that the event occured.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.Event.Clear
member.summary: Clears all listeners

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents
member.summary:
A manager of events that do not belong to any specific object but instead can be listened to by anyone and invoked by anyone.
Useful for GameLoaded, MatchEnded and similar events.
This uses which in turn uses interface instead of delegates in order to avoid the often short-lived memory they allocate.
This version is for parameterless events. See if you need to send data with the events.
Events are differentiated by an integer. You are expected to create constants to define your events.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents.Invoke(System.Int32)
member.summary: Invokes an event.
member.param: The id of the event.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents.AddListener(System.Int32,Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.IEventListener,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a listener for an event.
member.param: The id of the event.
The listener to be called.
The priority of the listener which affects the order which listeners are called in.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents.RemoveListener(System.Int32,Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.IEventListener)
member.summary: Removes a listener for an event.
member.param: The id of the event.
The listener to remove.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents.RemoveListener(Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.IEventListener)
member.summary: Removes the specified listener from all events.
member.param: The listener to unsubscribe from all events.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents.Clear
member.summary: Clears all listeners for all events.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents.Clear(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears all listeners for a single event.
member.param: The id of the event.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.GlobalEvents`1
member.summary:
A manager of events that do not belong to any specific object but instead can be listened to by anyone and invoked by anyone.
Useful for GameLoaded, MatchEnded and similar events.
This uses which in turn uses interface instead of delegates in order to avoid the often short-lived memory they allocate.
This version is for events with args. See if you need to send data with the events.
Events are differentiated by an integer. You are expected to create constants to define your events.

The listener to remove.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdate
member.summary:
A relay for Unity update events. Here's why you might want to use this: https://blogs.unity3d.com/2015/12/23/1k-update-calls/ In short; avoid overhead of Native C++ --> Managed C# calls.
Also useful for non-MonoBehaviours that needs to be part of the update loop as well.
Events your can subscribe to:

member.name: F:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdate.OnUpdate
member.summary: Event handler that is called every update.

member.name: F:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdate.OnLateUpdate
member.summary: Event handler that is called every update but after the regular Update.

member.name: F:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdate.OnFixedUpdate
member.summary: Event handler that is called every fixed update.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdate.EventIds
member.summary: Relayed event ids.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour
member.summary: A subclass of MonoBehaviour that uses for update events.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.ExecutionOrder
member.summary:
Affects whether this components' events will be called before or after others'.
Basically a reimplementation of Unity's ScriptExecutionOrder.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.UsesUpdate
member.summary: Whether you want to use .

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.UsesLateUpdate
member.summary: Whether you want to use .

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.UsesFixedUpdate
member.summary: Whether you want to use .

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.Start
member.summary: Start is called on the frame when a script is enabled just before any of the Update methods is called the first time.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.OnEnable
member.summary: Called when the component is enabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.OnDisable
member.summary: Called when the component is disabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.OnUpdate
member.summary: Called every frame if is true and the component is enabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.OnLateUpdate
member.summary: Called every frame just after if is true and the component is enabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.ManagedUpdateBehaviour.OnFixedUpdate
member.summary: This function is called every fixed framerate frame if is true and the component is enabled.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.TellMeWhen
member.summary: A utility class for getting notified after a specific amount of time.

member.name: F:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Events.TellMeWhen.NoId
member.summary: Default id, if none is supplied

member.summary: Schedule a callback to be called at a specific .
member.param: The at which the callback should be called.

An optional args object that will be passed to the callback.

Whether the timer should repeat untill cancelled.

member.summary:
Makes this 's part of the gravitational system.

member.summary: Represents a gravitational pull on entities.

member.summary: Calculates how much gravitational pull is at a specific location caused by this affecter.
member.param: The location to test.
member.returns: A vector representing the force at .

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.SphericalGravitationalPoint
member.summary:
A sphere-shaped gravitational point.
The force is currently constant and not dependent on how close the entities are.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.SphericalGravitationalPoint.Strength
member.summary: The gravitational pull of this point.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.SphericalGravitationalPoint.Radius
member.summary:
Gets or sets the radius of this gravitational point.
If is true, then this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.SphericalGravitationalPoint.IsGlobal
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this point should affect all entities regardless of whether they're in range.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.GravitationalEntity2D
member.summary: Makes this 's part of the gravitational system.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.GravitationalSystem
member.summary:
A gravitational system to allow for a more flexible gravity instead of just a constant directional gravity.
Useful for planets, black holes, magnets etc.
Rigidbodies that should be affected should have the component (or if using 2d physics).
Add gravitational forces by implementing the interface and registering it in the system. See for a simple example implementation.
You might want to set Unity's gravity to (0,0,0).

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.GravitationalSystem.Register(Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.IGravitationalAffecter)
member.summary: Registers a gravitational affecter to be part of the system.
member.param: The affecter to register.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.GravitationalSystem.Register(UnityEngine.Rigidbody)
member.summary: Registers a that should be affected by gravitational forces in this system.
member.param: The rigidbody to register.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.GravitationalSystem.Register(UnityEngine.Rigidbody2D)
member.summary: Registers a that should be affected by gravitational forces in this system.
member.param: The rigidbody to register.

member.param: The affecter to unregister.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Gravity.GravitationalSystem.Unregister(UnityEngine.Rigidbody)
member.summary: Unregisters a from the system, so it no longer is affected by gravitational forces in this system.
member.param: The rigidbody to unregister.

member.summary: Gets the sum of all gravitational forces at a specific location.
member.param: The location to test.
member.returns: A vector representing the sum of gravitational force at .

member.summary: Gets the modified delta after listeners of had their chance to affect it.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen
member.summary:
Adds resource to a pool at a constant rate or in intervals.
If the is not set, it will try to find a resource pool on the same GameObject.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets how often in seconds that resources should be gained.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen.AmountPerInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of resource that should be gained every .

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen.ConstantAmountPerSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of resource that should be gained per second.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen.DownTimeOnResourceLoss
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in seconds to stop healing after the loses resource.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target that should regen.

member.summary: Called when the MonoBehaviour is added to a GameObject.

member.summary: Called when the MonoBehaviour is enabled.

member.summary: Called when the MonoBehaviour is disabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.ResourceRegen.Update
member.summary: Called every frame.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield
member.summary:
A resource pool that is used to protect another resource pool from getting drained. The shield intercepts the event and applies some of the change to itself, only letting part (or none at all) of the change get through.
If the is not set, it will try to find a resource pool on the same GameObject.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.ProtectedTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the target that this shield should protect.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.AbsorptionFlat
member.summary: Gets or sets the flat amount of removed resource that should be absorbed by the shield.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.AbsorptionScaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction of removed resource that should be absorbed by the shield.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.EmptiesWithTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the shield should get fully drained when the target is empty.

member.name: P:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.RenewsWithTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the shield should renew when the target does.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.OnEnable
member.summary: Called when the MonoBehaviour is enabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.OnDisable
member.summary: Called when the MonoBehaviour is disabled.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.ResourceSystem.Shield.GetDefaultTarget
member.summary: Attempts to find a different resource pool on this GameObject.
member.returns: The found pool, or null if none were found.

member.name: T:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator
member.summary:
A (somewhat) simple implementation of the service locator pattern. The ServiceLocator knows about MonoBehaviours and how to work with them. Creating scene-specific resolvers that only live as long as their respective scene is also supported.
Please note that when you load a new scene, the MonoBehaviours in that scene will have their Awake() method called before their scene becomes the active one. This means you can't rely on SceneManager.GetActiveScene() to return the scene they're in, so you might want to use GameObject.scene to specify which scene to register the resolver for.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.RegisterSingleton``1
member.summary: Registers a concrete singleton of the given type.
member.typeparam: The type of the singleton.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.RegisterLazySingleton``1
member.summary: Registers a concrete singleton of the given type. The instance won't be created until the first time it is resolved.
member.typeparam: The type of the singleton.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.RegisterSingletonForScene``1
member.summary: Registers a scene-specific concrete singleton of the given type. The resolver is registered for the active scene according to .
member.typeparam: The type of the singleton.

member.summary: Registers a scene-specific concrete singleton of the given type. The instance won't be created until the first time it is resolved. The resolver is registered for the active scene according to .

member.param: The instance to register as a singleton.
The scene to register the transient type for.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.RegisterTransient``1
member.summary: Registers a concrete transient type. A new instance of the given type will be returned each time it is resolved.
member.typeparam: The concrete transient type to register.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.RegisterTransientForScene``1
member.summary: Registers scene-specific a concrete transient type. A new instance of the given type will be returned each time it is resolved. The resolver is registered for the active scene according to .
member.typeparam: The concrete transient type to register.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.Resolve``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Locates and returns a transient object or singleton of the specified type. Searches for a global object first, if nothing is found and is true then it searches for a scene specific resolver. Make sure the type is registered first.
member.typeparam: The type to locate an implementation for.
member.param: Whether to search for a scene specific resolver if a global one isn't found.
member.returns: The transient object or singleton that is mapped to the specified type. If nothing is registered for the default value for the type is returned.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.ResolveForScene``1
member.summary: Locates and returns a transient object or singleton of the specified type for the currently active scene. Make sure the type is registered first.
member.typeparam: The type to locate an implementation for.
member.returns: The transient object or singleton that is mapped to the specified type. If nothing is registered for the default value for the type is returned.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.ResolveForScene``1(UnityEngine.SceneManagement.Scene)
member.summary: Locates and returns a transient object or singleton of the specified type for the given scene. Make sure the type is registered first.
member.typeparam: The type to locate an implementation for.
member.returns: The transient object or singleton that is mapped to the specified type. If nothing is registered for the default value for the type is returned.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.IsRegistered``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether there's registered a resolver for a specific type.
member.typeparam: The type to check if registered.
member.param: Whether to search for a scene specific resolver if a global one isn't found.
member.returns: True if registered, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.IsRegisteredInScene``1
member.summary: Checks whether there's registered a scene-specific resolver for a specific type in the currently active scene.
member.typeparam: The type to check if registered.
member.returns: True if registered, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.IsRegisteredInScene``1(UnityEngine.SceneManagement.Scene)
member.summary: Checks whether there's registered a scene-specific resolver for a specific type in the specified scene.
member.typeparam: The type to check if registered.
member.returns: True if registered, false otherwise.

member.summary: Clears all resolvers.

member.summary: Clears global resolvers.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.ResetScene

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.ResetScene(UnityEngine.SceneManagement.Scene)
member.summary: Clears a specific scene's resolvers.

member.name: M:Archon.SwissArmyLib.Utils.ServiceLocator.ResetScenes
member.summary: Clears all scene specific resolvers for all scenes.

member.returns: The hex representation of .
